Class Geometry

java.lang.Object
Geometry
public class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
This program demonstrates static methods

    Geometry()

  • Constructor Details

    • Geometry

      public Geometry()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • printMenu

      public static void printMenu()
      This method displays the menu (series of options) when called. No arguments are used in this method.

    • circleArea

      public static double circleArea​(double radius)
      Returns the area of a circle. If user enters 1 on the menu, this method will ask user to enter a value for the radius. The radius argument must be a number. The result will be stored in the variable called value as a double.
      Parameters:
      radius - a number that the user will input into the program as the radius
      Returns:
      the value of the area of the circle

    • rectangleArea

      public static double rectangleArea​(double length, double width)
      Calculates and returns the area of a rectangle. Takes user input of length and width for arguments. Arguments must be numbers for this method to work. Calculates the area by multiplying the length and width together.
      Parameters:
      length - must be a positive number
      width - must be a positive number
      Returns:
      returns the value of the area as the variable called value.

    • triangleArea

      public static double triangleArea​(double base, double height)
      Calculates and returns the area of a triangle. Takes user input of base and height for arguments. Arguments must be numbers for this method to work. Calculates the area by taking 1/2 multiplied by the base multiplied by the height.
      Parameters:
      base - must be a positive number
      height - must be a positive number
      Returns:
      returns the value of the triangle area as the variable called value

    • circleCircumference

      public static double circleCircumference​(double radius)
      Calculates the circumference of a circle. Takes user input of radius for an argument. Argument must be a positive number. uses the equation circumference of circle = 2(pi)r
      Parameters:
      radius - the length of the radius of the circle
      Returns:
      the circumference of the circle stored in the variable called value.

    • rectanglePerimeter

      public static double rectanglePerimeter​(double length, double width)
      Calculates the perimeter of a rectangle. Takes arguments length and width from user input. Arguments must be a positive number. Uses the equation (2L)+(2W) to calculate the perimeter
      Parameters:
      length - the length of the length of the rectangle
      width - the length of the width of the rectangle
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the rectangle

    • trianglePerimeter

      public static double trianglePerimeter​(double side1, double side2, double side3)
      Calculates the triangle perimeter. Takes arguments side1, side2, and side3. All arguments must be positive numbers. Adds up all sides to calculate the perimeter.
      Parameters:
      side1 - length of side 1
      side2 - length of side 2
      side3 - length of side 3
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the triangle
